intro: Scolopia lucida, commonly known as the shining nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and tobacco. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, with a distinctive yellowish throat. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Scolopia lucida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
